lead_paragraph: Zach Lowe writes for CelticsHub.com. He grew up in Connecticut watching the Bird-era Celtics with his father and hating Chuck Person. He now lives in Manhattan and dreams of a day in his adult lifetime when the Celtics and the Knicks are both elite teams.
snippet: Ray Allen, 35, is a free agent, and traditional measures suggest signing him to a multiyear deal is a major risk. But there is one argument Allen has on his side: His teams play much better when he is on the floor.
